title: Two pipes can fill a tank in 10 minutes and 30 minutes respectively and a third pipe can empty the full tank in 50 minutes. If all the three pipes are opened simultaneously, what will the tank be? - Quora

response.answer_text: What will the tank be? That depends on the time. If it started full it will immediately overflow. At time zero it will be empty. In between it will be partially full depending on how much time has expired. Question Worded Correctly: If the tank is empty how long will it take to fill if all3 pipes are opened? 1/30+1/10–1/50 = 1/n 5/150+15/150–3/150 = 1/n 17/150 = 1/n n=150/17 = 8.82… It will take a little more than 8.8 minutes to fill the tank.
Let capacity of the tank be x Inflow rate is x/10 + x/ 30 — x /50 17x / 150 per minute To fill x lites we need to get the numerator as 150x It will 8.8 minutes
In 1 minute they fill 1/10 +1/30 - 1/50 = (15 +5 - 3) /150 = 17/150 ANSWER 150/17 OR 8.82 minutes ANSWER
